title: Flames flare out of a tree trunk as it burns from the inside out
text:
Flames billowed out of a tree trunk after it was struck by lightning during a thunderstorm.

The trunk appeared to have been almost entirely hollowed out by the fire as it burns from the inside out in Trinity, Texas.

Footage shows the tree almost split in two as the fire rages and smoke billows from holes in the trunk.

Flames billow out of a tree trunk after it was struck by lightning during a thunderstorm in Trinity, Texas

The camera pans to show another smaller point where flames pour out.

A wider shot shows the flames burning at the base of the trunk, near to the roots that are protruding from the ground.

Glenn Ratcliff, 44, filmed the awe-inspiring spectacle on October 17.

Footage shows the tree almost split in two as the fire rages and smoke billows from holes in the trunk. Glenn Ratcliff, 44, filmed the awe-inspiring spectacle on October 17

Mr Ratcliff, who is a small business owner, uploaded the unique video on social media.

Mr Ratcliff said: 'We had no wind that day and fortunately no trees around it caught fire.

'My reaction when I saw this tree on fire was sadness and a deep respect for mother nature.

'The scene was something that could never be explained, unless you watch the video.'

A similar spectacle was seen in Schellville, California, during the wildfires that raged in the state in 2017.
